item.title: SportsBet.io Euro 2016 Event in Full Swing, 36 BTC Awarded So Far
item.description:
SportsBet.io Euro 2016 Event in Full Swing, 36 BTC Awarded So Far

In the "biggest betting event since the 2014 World Cup," SportsBet.io has already awarded 36 BTC in prizes and two tickets to the European Championship final match as part of its Euro 2016 betting event. Disclaimer: This article was provided by Bitcoin PR Buzz.

item.title: Winklevoss Brothers Dump Nasdaq For Proposed Bitcoin Fund
item.description:
Winklevoss Brothers Dump Nasdaq For Proposed Bitcoin Fund

(Reuters) - Investors Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss on Wednesday filed to switch the listing of their proposed bitcoin exchange-traded fund to BATS Global Markets from Nasdaq, according to a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The Winklevoss brothers, identical twins, had filed their first application for a listing three years ago.

item.title: Will Bitcoin Make It Finally Make It Big? Digital Bank WB21 is Accepting Bitcoin Deposits
item.description:
Will Bitcoin Make It Finally Make It Big? Digital Bank WB21 is Accepting Bitcoin Deposits

Bitcoin is a currency that has always struggled to break into the mainstream. It's also a currency that is being mined at a faster and faster rate, with current virtual mining operations hitting 122 percent yields. Banks are naturally resistant to it because it acts as competition.

item.title: Blockchain Technology Will Make Smart Guns Smarter
item.description:
Blockchain Technology Will Make Smart Guns Smarter

Bitcoin.com spoke with Blocksafe CEO Kevin Barnes, whose startup brings blockchain and P2P networking to smart gun technology. This solution has the potential to eliminate unauthorized gun access, track missing firearms, and more importantly, reduce overall violence.

item.title: Kraken takes over Netherlands-based bitcoin exchange CleverCoin
item.description:
Kraken takes over Netherlands-based bitcoin exchange CleverCoin

Global digital asset exchange Kraken announced Tuesday it has acquired CleverCoin. The Dutch bitcoin exchange is the third exchange Kraken has taken over in less than six months. It acquired Coinse...

item.title: Arguments against Bitcoin using adaptive blocksizes
item.description:
Arguments against Bitcoin using adaptive blocksizes

Besides the risk of miners artificially increasing the average block size on purpose, what are some of the potential negatives of adaptive blocksizes? Are there any advantages of human set hard li...

item.title: Getting Closer To A Bitcoin ETF? Winklevoss Trust Chooses New Exchange
item.description:
Getting Closer To A Bitcoin ETF? Winklevoss Trust Chooses New Exchange

With recent events showing investor demand for Bitcoin, Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss inched closer to someday offering a Bitcoin ETF, making several amendments to their SEC filing.

item.title: Blockchain is on Presidential Candidate Hillary Clinton's Technology Agenda
item.description:
Blockchain is on Presidential Candidate Hillary Clinton's Technology Agenda

Democratic presidential hopeful and presumptive nominee Hillary Clinton has pledged support for public blockchain applications in a wider agenda for technology and innovation. Hillary Clinton, widely expected to run for the United States presidency as the chosen Democratic nominee has unveiled a "Technology & Innovation" initiative, outlining an agenda that includes blockchain solutions for the public sector.

item.title: Chinese Yuan Devaluation Fails to Fuel Bitcoin Price Rally - CoinDesk
item.description:
Chinese Yuan Devaluation Fails to Fuel Bitcoin Price Rally - CoinDesk

The connection between the Chinese yuan and the price of bitcoin appears to be weakening. Despite assertions that macroeconomic fears in China are one factor boosting the price of bitcoin, the nation's recent decision to lower the yuan's currency peg by the largest amount since August notably failed to cause a significant change in the digital currency's ...

item.title: Time to End the Block-Size Blockade | Roger Ver
item.description:
Time to End the Block-Size Blockade | Roger Ver

Recently I've seen a number of people in the Bitcoin ecosystem commenting that they think that Bitcoin blocks should always be completely full. This is analogous to thinking that Starbucks should always be completely sold out of coffee. Block space is like coffee in that it is a consumer good.
